column4: Uh.. I have no sound hardware all of a sudden.  Completely empty in Sound - Hardware. Ubuntu 11.10, dell precision M6600.. never had any problems until this boot-up.  Any advice?
can you pastebin the output of dmesg
the second one is a  graphics error, but the first one indicates that your v ideo card's hdmi out's sound was recognised
I don't have speakers on my hdmi output
I just want the internal sound card and speakers to work
and they've been fine until today
sounds like pulse audio messed up
there is alsa, which is the actual sound system, then pulse audio which is a layer on top that some software uses
if its still not showing hw in some apps, try restarting the pulse audio daemon
dont know how to do it on pidgin, but others like irssi support it
pidgin is pretty bare when it comes to setting, i suggest trying clients designed for irc specificly.
thats what #ubuntu-offtopic is all about, just switch channels when this one is too much :P
the binary drivers are usually faster and can do better pm
right, but there are no proprietary linux drivers for the mobility firepro cards yet
